intro: Antiphyla, commonly known as the "false holly," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It comprises several species, primarily found in South America, particularly in Brazil and Peru. These evergreen shrubs are characterized by their glossy, leathery leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are typically white or pale pink and bloom in spring or early summer. Antiphyla species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments.
